channel.title: Team_Rocket - How to create PvP Points, DonorPoints, ect. - OFFICIAL GUIDE -
channel.description:
I see alot of people posting "K NAO HEREZ HOW TO ADD DA DONATOR POINTS" when they barely know how to do it themselves, so it isn't explained. I decided I'd take time out of my busy schedule and show you how to do this in detail, (even though It's as easy as crossing the street).
[u][b]Declaring an Int:[/b][/u]
"Int" is short for Integer. An Integer holds value, they are whole numbers. There are multiple types of Integers: Int, Long, Short, and Byte a few. Today we'll only be working with Int.
If you're using a source such as a DeltaScape base, I recommend declaring the Int in your Player Class (Player.Java). Otherwise you'll want to just stick it in your Client Class, or where you see fit. I will now show you how to declare an int:
[code=java] public int pvpPoints = 0; [/code]
Good job, you have just declared an Int. You should feel proud of yourself (not really, but O.K).
[b][u]Saving an Int:[/u][/b]
Why do we need to make the Int save? Well, if you want to add something such as pvpPoints, if you don't make it save, they will be lost upon logging. Once you have declared the Int, you'll need to find your "SaveGame" method. This is most often declared as a Boolean. Below that method, you should see lines of code like this:
[code=java] characterfile.write("blahblahblah = ", 0, ##); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(blahblahblah), 0, Integer.toString(blahblahblah).length()); [/code] This is part of what writes what you wish into your Character's Saved Games.
[code=java]blahblahblah[/code] Is what the name of your Int will be.
[code=java]##[/code] Is the amount of character space allotted for the string. You'll need to adjust this according to how many letters your Int has. So it will look like this: [code=java] characterfile.write(pvpPoints = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(pvpPoints), 0, Integer.toString(pvpPoints).length()); [/code] (NOTE, THE SPACE ALSO COUNTS TOWARDS THE CHARACTERS)
[b][i][u]Loading an Int:[/u][/i][/b]
Now that you have the Save implemented, you need to make it load. You're going to be searching for something like "LoadGame", "LoadPlayerGame", ect. It's probably declared as an Int also. Once you find it, you'll be seeing something like this:
[code=java] } else if (token.equals("blahblahblah")) { blahblahblah = Integer.parseInt(token2); [/code]
All you need to do is replace the [code]blahblahblah[/code] with the name of your declared Int. So it will look like this:
[code=java] if (token.equals("pvpPoints")) { pvpPoints = Integer.parseInt(token2); [/code]
[b][i][u]Increasing and Manipulating Value:[/u][/i][/b]
Now that you have your Int successfully working, you'll want to know how to increase it. Well, I'm going to give you the Syntax you'll need for this:
[code=java] + addition of numbers, concatenation of Strings += add and assign numbers, concatenate and assign Strings - subtraction -= subtract and assign * multiplication *= multiply and assign ++ increment by one -- decrement by one > greater than >= greater than or equal to < less than <= less than or equal to ! boolean NOT != not equal to && boolean AND || boolean OR == boolean equals [/code] You are supposed to use each of these accordingly, for instance. If you want to add an exception in a Shop which uses PvPPoints as a currency, It's format would look something like this: (I've taken the liberty of quoting the operators so you'll know)
[code=java] If TheItemYou'reBuying == 3875 "&&" pvpPoints ">=" TheAmountOfPointsItCosts AddItem(##, ##); pvpPoints "-=" TheAmountOfPointsItCosts [/code]
[center][b][i][u]PLEASE, if you have any questions or errors please post them. The symbols I've used for this tutorial WILL NOT be the same in all sources, and you'll probably need to correct them with the ones your source uses.[/u][/i][/b][/center]

item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“lemme_winks_, post:95, topic:426550”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=529245.msg3866514#msg3866514 date=1325039237]
^ Yes… because I don’t brag. I like pointing out the stupid shit other people do. Better add yourself to your list.
[/quote]

implying i bragged out anything. i never once said i am greater than anybody, i just said imsupergay05 was completely retarded, because it’s true. if you consider me, being nice enough after an attempt at being “successfully trolled”, to explain to him what a c++ fundamental datatype is stupid, then maybe you just have bad character.

ps: nice de-rep feedback. are you currently seeing a psychiatrist? if not, i highly advise you do.[/quote]
um the c++ thing was a troll you u retard… thought u would notice it but u havnt been here long anough to know so um [quote=“lemme_winks_, post:91, topic:426550”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=529245.msg3866473#msg3866473 date=1325037386]

i am seriously reconsidering the title i gave to you. i think “kids who need to wear helmets” is not enough and doing you right. you need something more like “kids who belong in an insane asylum/mental institution for being legitimately and dangerously retarded”

Please stop acting like you’re the best on this forum because you’re far from it. I highly doubt you could do anything that superman could (RSPS programming). You’re probably a 12 year old sitting in front of his computer acting tough because it’s over the internet.
[/quote]

you got me; and the fact that you said i was inferior to imsupergay05 due to his “1337 rsps programming skills” only shows you don’t have enough experience yourself to bring yourself into this argument.

might as well go an-hero because i can’t RSPS enough for you, [/quote]
thank you i relaly am gay, im really happy. if u were here long enouf u would know me but nah it k u can keep thinking what u want PLUS UR MAD U DONT HAVE somebody who praises u

[size=36pt]STICKS AND STONES MAY BREAK MY BONES BUT WORDS WILL NEVER HURT ME[/size]
